alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:07PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wayne County through 545 PM CDT... At 506 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Goodwater, or 11 miles south of Quitman, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro and Clara. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
